article.headline: UVSC 74, UMKC 59
article.story: OREM, Utah (AP) -- Matt Peterson and Richard Troyer scored 18 points each to lead Utah Valley State to a 74-59 win over Missouri-Kansas City Tuesday. With the score tied midway through the first half, the Wolverines (9-5) went on a 22-4 run to go ahead 38-20. For the rest of the game, the Kangaroos (4-11) never trailed by fewer than 12 points. UVSC sophomore Ryan Toolson came off the bench to jump-start the decisive Wolverine rally. In quick succession, Toolson made a 3-pointer, fast-break layup and mid-range jump shot to give Utah Valley a 23-16 lead. Troyer put an exclamation mark on the 22-4 run, sinking a 3-pointer from the left wing and two long jump shots within a span of 90 seconds for a 38-20 advantage. UMKC guard Quinton Day made three 3-pointers in the first five minutes of play to help the Kangaroos surge to an early 12-7 lead. Day finished with a team-high 17 points, but after his initial offensive outburst he shot just 3-for-13 from the field and 0-for-5 on 3-pointers. Peterson scored 10 of Utah Valley's first 14 points, keeping the Wolverines in the game during Day's hot streak. Dee Ayuba scored 14 points for UMKC. Toolson finished with 11 points for UVSC.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
